snippet: Citing restructuring and other charges, AOL said its first-quarter profit dropped to $9.3 million, or 11 cents a share, from $25.9 million a year earlier.
abstract: AOL's stock plummets more than 20 percent after company reports that net income fell 64 percent because of restructuring and other charges; profit dropped to $9.3 million, or 11 cents a share, from $25.9 million a year earlier; shares close at $34.85, down 20.62 percent from $43.90 day before.
lead_paragraph: Citing restructuring and other charges, AOL said its first-quarter profit dropped to $9.3 million, or 11 cents a share, from $25.9 million a year earlier.

headline.main: AOL Profit Slides 64%, Sending Its Shares Down 20%
headline.print_headline: AOL Profit Slides 64%, Sending Its Shares Down 20%
